column4: guys, I have an eps graph figure that i need to edit (add text, arrows ...) what is the best program for doing this?
inkscape?
so you recommend that one?!
it's what I use to touch up eps graphs.. that and a text editor
i just need to make some boxes and some arrows with text to explain my idea
create from scratch? or you have an eps file you want to edit?
i generate it from octave
or matlab (the same)
well.. you can use octave to make boxes and arrows..
i also need to put one graph inside the other .. is for a poster
is like in the corner of one graph it will be another which is what i want to achieve
i am shore i cannot do this with octave
it can be done using matlab at least..
another thing.. I just fired up inkscape just now.. seems I just get an error message when I try to open an eps file.. not really sure if I've updated someting since I used it
must programs have that problem .. they don't open eps
so what would you use for eps editing?
hang on.. I'm trying to find out what I have been using
you're just doing regular graphs from octave? you could do them in gnuplot if you want.. it seems to have a bit more features compared to octave
i could but the thing is .. can then you add one graph (inside the other)?
yes.. gnuplot can do that
but its just command line right?
i would like to have something more drag and drop
here are samples of gnuplot diagrams.. with source code
well.. I don't really know of anything that does that..
